data.title: CLARIFY
questions: In this phase, clarify the issue, its magnitude and the stakes…
How would you define the ‘issue’?
What’s especially challenging about it?
What do you see as the biggest obstacle?
To what extent do you see it as a ‘problem’?
How has your thinking about it changed over time?
On a scale of 1-10, how big is this for you?
What’s at stake—if successful and if not?

data.title: REFRAME
questions: In this phase, review the data and reframe the situation…
What’s the data? No inferences or interpretations.
What’s another way of looking at the raw data?
What at its essence is the situation?
What’s happening right now? What’s your part in it?
What would help the situation? Make it work for you?
What plentiful resource or talent could you apply to this?
How might you apply or leverage one of your strengths?
What one thing, if different, would really improve things?
What if you could change that variable…how would you?

data.title: IMAGINE
questions: In this phase, explore creative and imaginative opportunities…
What could you learn from this? What’s it teaching you?
How might you turn the obstacle into a way forward?
How would your favorite superhero handle it?
What variable, if removed, would significantly change things?
What’s a creative or artistic way of visualizing it? Draw it.
What’s a metaphor or analogy for it? What’s it like?
What fairy tale, fantasy or adventure does it remind you of?
Who are you in the story? How would you write the ending?
To what extent do you see yourself succeeding? What does it look like?
How would your role model handle it? What would he/she do?
What opportunity might come your way because of it?

data.title: AFFIRM
questions: In this phase, affirm how dealing with this actually helps you…
What’s one good thing about tackling this?
How could it actually help you? Stretch you?
How might you embrace it? Move into it?
What do you personally need out of the process? And the solution?
How can you get your needs met? Who could help you?
Who wants you to succeed at this? Who else?
How specifically would this person(s) help you?
How would you approach him/her for that help?
What’s the upside in taking a small step or risk?
What else do you need to affirm about this situation?

data.title: SOLVE
questions: In this phase, synthesize insights into options for moving forward…
Now, how do you see your obstacle?
What/where/who is the real issue? How do you address that?
What’s your ultimate goal? Working backwards from that…
What’s the first step toward reaching your goal?
What are 3 different things you could try?
For each one, what would be the likely result?
What are the pros & cons of each approach? Which is best?
What’s one step you could immediately take in that direction?
What will you do right now?
